meanings.definition: Delfs (noun): plural form of delf, meaning a small valley or hollow.
meanings.sent1: The hikers explored the delfs in the forest, enjoying the peaceful surroundings.
meanings.sent2: The delfs were filled with wildflowers, creating a beautiful sight.
meanings.sent3: The animals made their homes in the delfs, creating a cozy community.
meanings.sent4: The delfs whispered secrets of ancient times to those who listened closely.
meanings.sent5: The delfs seemed to cradle the sunlight, casting shadows in the afternoon.

meanings.definition: Delfs (verb): third person singular present of delf, meaning to dig or excavate.
meanings.sent1: He delfs a hole in the ground to plant the seeds for the garden.
meanings.sent2: She delfs carefully, making sure not to disturb any buried treasures.
meanings.sent3: The archaeologist delfs with precision, uncovering artifacts from the past.
meanings.sent4: The machines delfs relentlessly, transforming the landscape around them.
meanings.sent5: The children delfs in the sand, creating imaginary worlds with their hands.

meanings.definition: Delfs (adjective): comparative form of delf, meaning more deep or profound.
meanings.sent1: Her thoughts were delfs, delving into the mysteries of the universe.
meanings.sent2: The book offered a delfs insight into the complexities of human nature.
meanings.sent3: His delfs understanding of the topic impressed his classmates.
